comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Ernest Arthur Muret, a "self-styled dentist" with some very shady friends--indicted for counterfeiting and conspiracy in September 1913. He's a major figure in Mark Gado's Killer Priest: The Crimes, Trials, and Execution of Father Hans Schmidt (Greenwood Publishing 2006).

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Here are two New York Times stories about the case from September 1913. Detective Richard M. McKenna was one of five police officers who received honorable mentions and commendations from Commissioner Waldo for the part they played in clearing the Aumuller murder case. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A00E0DA163DE633A... and query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C01E4D9163DE633A... Neither story explains how they come to be photographed together on the street however.
